description: From Latin abscindere, present active infinitive of abscindō (“cut off”), from ab (“from, away from”) + scindō (“cut, rend”).

verbs.description: abscind (third-person singular simple present abscinds, present participle abscinding, simple past and past participle abscinded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To cut off. [First attested in the early 17th century.]
examples: Two syllables... abscinded from the rest.
